partners: Oil and gas companies, governments, refineries, transportation providers
keyActivities: Exploration, production, refining, transportation, and marketing of oil and gas
keyResources: Oil and gas reserves, infrastructure, equipment, technology, expertise
valueProposition: Reliable and efficient supply of energy products for a wide range of customers, meeting global energy demands
customerRelationships: Long-term contracts, partnerships with governments and other companies, customer support for commercial and industrial clients
channels: Oil and gas pipelines, shipping, retail stations, wholesalers, direct sales to commercial and industrial clients
revenueStreams: Sales of crude oil, natural gas, refined products, petrochemical products
problem: Increasing global energy demand and limited resources
existingAlternatives: Competitors like Chevron, BP, Shell, and alternative energy sources like renewables
solution: Continued investment in exploration and production, as well as research and development of new energy technologies
keyMetrics: Production and reserve volumes, refinery throughput, sales volumes, financial performance
uniqueSellingProposition: Strong global presence, vast experience, and technological expertise in the oil and gas industry
highLevelConcept: Meeting global energy demand through a diverse portfolio of oil and gas assets
unfairAdvantage: Extensive experience and strong brand reputation in the oil and gas industry
earlyAdopters: Countries and industries with growing energy demands
mobileAdvantages: Mobile app for retail customers to locate gas stations, track rewards, and access promotions
appIntegrations: Integration with mobile wallets and third-party reward programs
location: Global presence with operations in various countries
attractUsers: Promotions, loyalty programs, and partnerships with other businesses
offline: Physical retail stations and direct sales to commercial and industrial clients
appSavings: Loyalty rewards and promotions for retail customers
inAppPayments: Mobile wallet integration for payments at retail stations
peopleAndRoles: Executive leadership, management teams, engineers, geoscientists, and other professionals
commonGoals: Profitable growth, meeting global energy demands, and sustainable operations
personalGoals: Career development, expertise in the oil and gas industry, contributing to the global energy supply
purpose: To provide energy products and services that help drive economic growth and improve living standards
values: Safety, operational excellence, environmental responsibility, and ethical conduct
needsAndExpectations: Job security, career growth, and a safe and inclusive work environment
rulesAndActivities: Compliance with regulations, safety protocols, and industry best practices
strengthsAndAssets: Vast experience, global presence, and a strong portfolio of oil and gas assets
weaknessesAndRisks: Dependence on finite resources, fluctuations in oil and gas prices, environmental concerns
buyerPersona: Individual consumers, businesses, and governments seeking reliable and efficient energy solutions
buyerGoals: Access to affordable and reliable energy products and services
buyerInitiatives: Energy efficiency measures, investments in alternative energy sources
buyingProcess: Individual consumers purchase, at retail stations, while businesses and governments enter into contracts and partnerships with Exxon
buyTiming: Energy purchases are often continuous and ongoing, with some seasonality in demand
buyerThinking: Buyers need a reliable energy supplier with competitive prices and efficient operations
buyerChannels: Retail stations, direct sales to commercial and industrial clients, government contracts
whyBuy: Exxon's strong reputation, global presence, and expertise in the oil and gas industry
buyerInfluencers: Energy prices, government regulations, environmental concerns, and corporate sustainability initiatives
buyerContent: Buyers are interested in pricing, availability, reliability, and environmental impact of energy products and services
strengths: Strong global presence, extensive experience, and technological expertise in the oil and gas industry
opportunities: Investment in alternative energy sources, expansion in emerging markets, advancements in technology
weaknesses: Vulnerability to fluctuations in oil and gas prices, environmental concerns, dependence on finite resources
threats: Increasing competition, government regulations, growing demand for renewable energy sources
productsAndServices: Crude oil, natural gas, refined products, petrochemical products, retail stations
gainCreators: Efficient supply and delivery of energy products, meeting global energy demands
painRelievers: Reliable energy supply, competitive pricing, and technological advancements
gains: Buyers benefit from reliable and efficient energy products and services
pains: Buyers face challenges in meeting their energy needs amid rising demand and environmental concerns
customerJobs: Individuals, businesses, and governments seeking to fulfill their energy needs and support economic growth
